alert.note: Alert for Alpine (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 17 at 2:12PM PDT until further notice by NWS Reno
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Nevada... California... West Fork Carson River At Woodfords affecting Alpine and Douglas Counties. .Warm temperatures will melt high mountain snowpack and increase river flows along the West Fork Carson River and nearby small feeder streams. For the West Fork Carson River...including Woodfords...Minor flooding is expected to continue. The peak flows along the river will be highest during the overnight hours. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt is expected. The highest flows will occur late evening into the overnight hours each day. * WHERE...West Fork Carson River At Woodfords. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Minor flooding in the southwestern Carson Valley between Centerville and Genoa, impacting agricultural areas, local roads, and outbuildings. Impacts will be more significant if heavy rain and/or snowmelt cause significant rises in small creeks draining the east side of the Carson Range below Woodfords. Possible lane closures on Highway 395 north of Stephanie Way if combined with flood flows on the East Fork. Similar peak level to January 2017 event and May 2017 peak snowmelt. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:50 PM PDT Wednesday the stage was 13.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate within minor flood stage with a maximum value of 14.2 feet early Sunday morning. - Action stage is 12.5 feet. - Flood stage is 13.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood https://www.cnrfc.noaa.gov &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Water will be swift moving and very cold. If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Additional river forecast information can be found at www.cnrfc.noaa. gov The next statement will be issued Friday afternoon by 215 PM PDT.
